content.1: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become
content.3: And though I bestow all my goods to feed
content.5: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;
content.6: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;
content.7: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.
content.9: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.
content.10: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.
content.11: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
content.12: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.
content.13: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these
